meanings.definition: To surpass or outdo in a competition or contest.
meanings.sent1: In the race, Sarah managed to outtrump all her competitors and win the gold medal.
meanings.sent2: The new athlete trained hard to outtrump the previous record holder in the high jump.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel outtrumped the other animals in the nut-gathering competition.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to outtrump her own limitations was truly inspiring.
meanings.sent5: The sun outtrumping the clouds, shining brightly in the sky.

meanings.definition: To outshine or outperform someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The talented singer always manages to outtrump the other performers with her powerful voice.
meanings.sent2: The student worked hard to outtrump his classmates in the science fair project.
meanings.sent3: The clown outtrumped the magician with his hilarious tricks.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness outtrumped any material possessions she could offer.
meanings.sent5: The stars outtrumping the city lights, lighting up the night sky beautifully.

meanings.definition: To exceed or outclass in a particular area.
meanings.sent1: The new model of the car outtrumps all previous versions in terms of speed and efficiency.
meanings.sent2: The chef's signature dish always manages to outtrump all other menu items in popularity.
meanings.sent3: The superhero outtrumped all villains with his incredible powers.
meanings.sent4: Her intelligence outtrumped her lack of experience in the challenging task.
meanings.sent5: The waterfall outtrumping all other natural wonders in its grandeur and beauty.
